Notes: Roman. First to abdicate after exile to Sardinia by Emperor Maximinus Thrax. The Liberian Catalogue records his death on 28 September 235, the earliest exact date in papal history.[10][11]

Date and Place of birth: c. 180 AD Rome, Italia, Roman Empire[birth 4]
Notes: Roman. Died as a martyr through extreme hardship; feast day 16 September.

Notes: Roman. Founder of Novatianism. In opposition to Cornelius, Lucius I, Stephen I and Sixtus II.
